![](~/profwebsite.git/photos for site/headshot.jpeg)

I am a first year MS student in the Entomology department at Cornell University and an NSF GRFP fellow. I study ant social behavior and coordination in the <a href="http://www.moreaulab.entomology.cornell.edu/people/corrie-moreau/">Moreau lab</a>. I am interested in behavioral ecology at all levels of analysis. I plan to study how large groups of social insects have evolved to coordinate through decentralized systems, accomplishing grand tasks.

## Positions
**April 2018-August 2020** Technician at Cornell university. Half time in <a href="https://cei.ece.cornell.edu/">Kirstin Petersen's Robotics lab</a> and half time in <a href="http://blogs.cornell.edu/mcartlab/people/">Scott McArt's pollinator lab</a>.

**October 2016-March 2018** Midwest honey bee extension agent for the Bee Informed Partnership <a href="https://beeinformed.org/services/tech-teams/">Technical Transfer Team</a>.

**March 2016-October 2016** Field Assistant at the University of Minnesota in <a href="https://www.beelab.umn.edu/meet-us/dr-marla-spivak">Marla Spivak's honey bee lab</a> 

**August 2013-January 2016** BS Entomology student at Cornell University, and assitant in <a href="http://pages.nbb.cornell.edu/seeley.shtml">Tom Seeley's honey bee behavior lab</a>
